qas.question: What is the most popular type of poulty that is farmed?

answers.text: Worldwide, more chickens are kept than any other type of poultry

qas.question: How many birds are routinely raised in the world for the consumption process?

answers.text: 50 billion birds being raised each year as a source of meat and eggs.

qas.question: How is the cost of the price for animal feed related to the poulty cost for consumers?

answers.text: High feed costs could limit further development of poultry production

qas.question: Before industrialization how were chickens normally cared for?

answers.text: birds would have been kept extensively in small flocks, foraging during the day and housed at night.

qas.question: What is the major significance of chickens to women in underdeveloped countries?

answers.text: the women often make important contributions to family livelihoods through keeping poultry

qas.question: What is the worst type of poultry that is farmed?

plausible_answers.text: 50 billion birds being raised each year as a source of meat and eggs

qas.question: How many birds are ritualistically sacrificed in the world for the consumption process?

plausible_answers.text: High feed costs could limit further development of poultry production

qas.question: How is the cost of the price for animal feed unrelated to the poultry cost for consumers?

plausible_answers.text: the women often make important contributions to family livelihoods through keeping poultry

qas.question: What is the major danger of chickens to women in underdeveloped countries?

context: <a0_0>Worldwide, more <b5_0>chickens<b5_0/> are kept than any other type of poultry<a0_0/>, with over <a1_0><b6_0>50 billion birds being raised each year as a source of meat and eggs<b6_0/>.<a1_0/> Traditionally, such <a3_0>birds would have been kept extensively in small flocks, foraging during the day and housed at night.<a3_0/> This is still the case in developing countries, where <a4_0><b8_0>the women often make important contributions to family livelihoods through keeping poultry<b8_0/><a4_0/>. However, rising world populations and urbanization have led to the bulk of production being in larger, more intensive specialist units. These are often situated close to where the feed is grown or near to where the meat is needed, and result in cheap, safe food being made available for urban communities. Profitability of production depends very much on the price of feed, which has been rising. <a2_0><b7_0>High feed costs could limit further development of poultry production<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
